newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: South Korean Red Cross to offer flour to North.
newsitem.headline: South Korean Red Cross to offer flour to North.

text.p: South Korea's Red Cross said it would offer 3,000 tonnes of flour to the North at a meeting with the North Korean Red Cross in Beijing on Friday.
A statement on Wednesday said the South Korean Red Cross would fund the flour purchase of one billion won ($1.12 million) from its own budget, not from private donations.
"We plan to offer the food aid at the next meeting," said an official at the South Korean Red Cross.
The inter-Korean Red Cross talks on speeding up food aid to North Korea will resume on Friday in Beijing after Seoul backed down and agreed to the Chinese capital as a venue.

The last round of talks on May 3 and 5 were also held in Beijing, but they broke down after the North demanded to know the exact amount of aid it could expect before discussing moves to speed up delivery.
The South has now agreed to that demand.
